p: The satellite altimeter record of GMSL is shown in Fig. 1 ( 14). These data reflect a recent update to the TOPEX measurements discussed in ref. 15 following earlier empirical work by refs. 16 and 17. The acceleration obtained by fitting a quadratic to this updated 25-y record is 0.097 mm/y 2. As described in ref. 12, the eruption of Mount Pinatubo in 1991 caused a decrease in GMSL just before the launch of TOPEX, followed by a slow recovery that resulted in an apparent deceleration of sea level of −0.02 ± 0.01 mm/y 2 over the 25-y record. To isolate the climate-change–driven acceleration, we remove this effect ( Fig. 1), which increases the acceleration of the adjusted GMSL record from 0.097 to 0.117 mm/y 2.
